newsitem.title: UK: Southern Electric extends repurchase offer.
newsitem.headline: Southern Electric extends repurchase offer.

text.p: UK regional electricity company Southern Electric Plc said on Monday that it had extended its offer to repurchase its 'B' shares until April 1, 1997.
Southern Electric said it had decided to extend the offer for shareholders' entire holdings of B shares following the strong response to the current offer covering 423 million shares.
Southern Electricity, one of the last main independent electricity firms in the UK, is repurchasing the shares at 30 pence per share at a total of 127.2 million stg.
The company said it had already received valid repurchase offer forms representing 81.84 percent of "B" shares.
The extended repurchase offer is also being made by SBC Warburg, its agent for the first stage of offer. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 4366
